meanings.definition: A gesture of greeting or acknowledgment.
meanings.sent1: He gave a friendly salut to his neighbor.
meanings.sent2: The soldier saluted his commanding officer.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed a little salut to the passing dog.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays offered a warm salut to the morning dew.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's smile was a cheerful salut to the students.

meanings.definition: A formal expression of greeting or goodwill.
meanings.sent1: She received a heartfelt salut from her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The diplomat exchanged saluts with the foreign ambassador.
meanings.sent3: The cake's delicious aroma was a sweet salut to the guests.
meanings.sent4: The majestic mountain peak stood as a grand salut to the sky.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze whispered a peaceful salut to the trees.

meanings.definition: To greet or acknowledge someone with a salutation.
meanings.sent1: He will salut his friend when they meet.
meanings.sent2: She saluted the passing parade with a wave.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel saluted the bird with a nut offering.
meanings.sent4: The flowers saluted the sun by blooming brightly.
meanings.sent5: The athlete saluted the crowd with a victorious wave.
